intro: Pimpinella cordata, commonly known as heartleaf cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are often hairy and have a distinct lobed appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Pimpinella cordata is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
